IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: WE CONNECT COLORADANS TO THE CHARITIES AND CAUSES THEY CARE ABOUT MOST. OUR PURPOSE IS TO RAISE AND ALLOCATE MONEY TO THE MEMBER ORGANIZATIONS, INCREASE PUBLIC VISIBILITY OF MEMBER ORGANIZATIONS, PROMOTE COOPERATION BETWEEN MEMBER ORGANIZATIONS, AND TO PROVIDE A FORUM FOR DIVERSE ORGANIZATIONS TO NETWORK.
IRS990.MissionDesc: WE CONNECT COLORADANS TO THE CHARITIES AND CAUSES THEY CARE ABOUT MOST. OUR PURPOSE IS TO RAISE AND ALLOCATE MONEY TO THE MEMBER ORGANIZATIONS, INCREASE PUBLIC VISIBILITY OF MEMBER ORGANIZATIONS, PROMOTE COOPERATION BETWEEN MEMBER ORGANIZATIONS, AND TO PROVIDE A FORUM FOR DIVERSE ORGANIZATIONS TO NETWORK.
IRS990.Desc: COMMUNITY GIVING CAMPAIGN: THE COMMUNITY GIVING CAMPAIGN IS THE ORGANIZATION'S PRIMARY PROGRAM AND IS DEDICATED TO RAISING FUNDS FOR NONPROFIT ORGANIZATIONS VIA WORKPLACE GIVING CAMPAIGNS. THE ORGANIZATION PARTNERS WITH BUSINESSES WHO INVITE EMPLOYEES TO GIVE EITHER A CASH GIFT OR DONATION FROM EACH PAYCHECK. THE COMMUNITY GIVING CAMPAIGN INCLUDES PARTNERING WITH BUSINESSES TO PLAN AND IMPLEMENT GIVING CAMPAIGNS, OFFERING THE OPTION OF MAKING PAYCHECK CONTRIBUTIONS OR CASH GIFTS TO INDIVIDUAL EMPLOYEES, AND IDENTIFYING POTENTIAL NEW WORKPLACE PARTNERS.DISTRIBUTIONS: THE CALCULATION AND DISBURSEMENT OF WORKPLACE CONTRIBUTIONS TO NONPROFIT ORGANIZATIONS, ALONG WITH THE DISTRIBUTION OF CAMPAIGN REPORTS TO NONPROFIT ORGANIZATIONS.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: COLORADO COMBINED CAMPAIGN: EFFECTIVE JANUARY 1, 2014, THE ORGANIZATION BEGAN ADMINISTERING THE COLORADO COMBINED CAMPAIGN (CCC). THE CCC WAS AUTHORIZED IN JUNE 1988 BY EXECUTIVE ORDER NO. 86, ESTABLISHMENT OF THE COLORADO STATYE EMPLOYEE ADVISORY COMMITTEE ON CHARITABLE GIVING, TO CONDUCT AN ANNUAL SOLICITATION OF STATE OF COLORADO EMPLOYEES, WHICH IS KNOWN AS THE COLORADO COMBINED CAMPAIGN. THE ORGANIZATION SERVES AS THE PRINCIPAL COMBINED FUNDRAISING MANAGER FOR THE CCC AND, BY CONTRACT, COLLECTS ALL PUBLIC SUPPORT AND CHARGES THE CCC FOR CAMPAIGN AND ADMINISTRATIVE EXPENSES.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: BUILDING COMMUNITY: THE BUILDING COMMUNITY PROGRAM LEVERAGES THE ORGANIZATION'S RELATIONSHIPS WITH CHARITIES, DONORS, AND BUSINESSES TO PHILANTHROPY ACROSS THE STATE.COMMUNITY EDUCATION INCLUDES SPEAKING TO CIVID AND OTHER GROUPS ABOUT THE IMPORTANCE OF PHILANTHROPY, NONPROFIT LEADERSHIP AND VOLUNTEER OPPORTUNITIES, AND REFERRALS TO NONPROFIT AGENCIES PROVIDING DIRECT SERVICES AVAILABLE IN COLORADO.THE PARTNERSHIP INITIATIVES UNDER THIS PROGRAM AREA ARE CSR SOLUTIONS OF COLORADO AND THE CIVIC 50 COLORADO TO PROVIDE RESOURCES, SUPPORT, AND REPORTING FOR BEST PRACTICES IN CORPORATE SOCIAL RESPONSIBILITY IN COLORADO.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION APPLIES A MORE-LIKELY-THAN-NOT MEASUREMENT METHODOLOGY TO REFLECT THE FINANCIAL STATEMENT IMPACT OF UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS TAKEN OR EXPECTED TO BE TAKEN IN A TAX RETURN. AFTER EVALUATING THE TAX POSITIONS TAKE, NONE ARE CONSIDERED TO BE UNCERTAIN; THEREFORE, NO AMOUNTS HAVE BEEN RECOGNIZED FOR THE TAX YEAR.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Part XI, Line 4b: Other revenue amounts included on 990 but not included in F/S
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: AMOUNTS RAISED ON BEHALF OF OTHER ORGANI $1482372

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: AMOUNTS RAISED ON BEHALF OF OTHER ORGANI $1482372

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Grantmaker's Description of How Grants are Used
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: COMMUNITY SHARES OF COLORADO PRIMARILY FUNDS NONPROFIT ORGANIZATIONS THAT HAVE BEEN ACCEPTED AS MEMBERS AND COMPLETE AN ANNUAL RE-CERTIFICATION PROCESS. A CONDITION OF MEMBERSHIP IS THAT 85% OF FUNDS BE SPENT IN THE STATE OF COLORADO. ALL NONPROFITS ANNUALLY SUBMIT AN IRS 990 OR 990-EZ TAX RETURN AND AN IRS 501(C)(3) DETERMINATION LETTER DATED WITHIN THE PAST FIVE YEARS. OUR REVIEW OF GOVERNANCE, FINANCIAL, AND PROGRAM MATERIALS IS ALIGNED WITH IRS'S VOLUNTARY COMPLIANCE RECOMMENDATIONS.COMMUNITY SHARES OF COLORADO DISTRIBUTES FUNDS ON BEHALF OF THE COLORADO COMBINED CAMPAIGN. ANNUALLY, ALL PARTICIPANTS IN THE CCC AFFIRM IN A MEMORANDUM OF UNDERSTANDING THEY ARE IN COMPLIANCE WITH ALL STATUTES OF THE UNITED STATES OF AMERICA PATRIOT ACT. ADDITIONALLY, ALL APPLICANTS SUBMIT A FULL APPLICATION OF GOVERNANCE DOCUMENTATION WHICH IS APPROVED ANNUALLY BY THE CCC ADVISORY COMMITTEE.COMMUNITY SHARES OF COLORADO PERMITS DONORS TO "WRITE-IN" NONPROFITS THAT ARE NOT MEMBERS OF THE ORGANIZATION. THESE NONPROFITS ARE CHECKED FOR CURRENT IRS STATUS AND PATRIOT ACT COMPLIANCE ON GUIDESTAR. TO HELP NONPROFITS AND DONORS COMPLY WITH THE PATRIOT ACT, GUIDESTAR REVIEWS EVERY OFAC PUBLICATION AS WELL AS THE IRS BULLETIN AND IMMEDIATELY FLAGS ANY NONPROFIT IDENTIFIED AS QUESTIONABLE OR HAS HAD ITS NONPROFIT STATUS REVOKED.

OTHER PROGRAM SERVICES 4: COLORADO COMBINED CAMPAIGN: EFFECTIVE JANUARY 1, 2014, THE ORGANIZATION BEGAN ADMINISTERING THE COLORADO COMBINED CAMPAIGN (CCC). THE CCC WAS AUTHORIZED IN JUNE 1988 BY EXECUTIVE ORDER NO. 86, ESTABLISHMENT OF THE COLORADO STATYE EMPLOYEE ADVISORY COMMITTEE ON CHARITABLE GIVING, TO CONDUCT AN ANNUAL SOLICITATION OF STATE OF COLORADO EMPLOYEES, WHICH IS KNOWN AS THE COLORADO COMBINED CAMPAIGN. THE ORGANIZATION SERVES AS THE PRINCIPAL COMBINED FUNDRAISING MANAGER FOR THE CCC AND, BY CONTRACT, COLLECTS ALL PUBLIC SUPPORT AND CHARGES THE CCC FOR CAMPAIGN AND ADMINISTRATIVE EXPENSES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, Line 6
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION HAS MEMBERS THAT PAY DUES ON AN ANNUAL BASIS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 11b
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE CEO AND THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS RECEIVE A COPY OF THE IRS FORM 990 VIA EMAIL. THE BOARD CAN SUBMIT COMMENTS OR QUESTIONS BASED ON THEIR REVIEW PRIOR TO THE RETURN FILING DATE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 12c
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE BOARD MONITORS COMPLIANCE WITH THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY THROUGH AN ONGOING PROCESS THAT INCLUDES ANNUAL DISCLOSURES OF POTENTIAL CONFLICTS OF INTEREST. THIS SURVERY IS CIRCULATED TO ALL BOARD MEMBERS, EMPLOYEES, COMMITTEE MEMBERS OR CONSULTANTS WHO HAVE THE ABILITY TO INFLUENCE DECISION WITHIN THE ORGANIZATON. IN ADDITION, A DETAILED WRITTEN DESCRIPTION OF EACH CONFLICT OF INTEREST IS PROVIDED ANNUALLY TO THE BOARD PRESIDENT OF THEIR REVIEW TO ENSURE COMPLIANCE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 15a
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD COMPLETES AN ANNUAL PERFORMANCE REVIEW OF THE CEO. THIS REVIEW IS CONSIDERED, ALONG WITH AVAILABLE SALARY SURVEYS AND BUDGET PERFORMANCE IN ORDER TO REACH A CONSENSUS ON A RECOMMENDATION FOR THE COMPENSATION TO BE PRESENTED TO THE ENTIRE BOARD. THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE MAKES ITS RECOMMENDATION TO THE BOARD IN A CLOSED EXECUTIVE SESSION. A MOTION IS MADE, FOLLOWED BY DISCUSSION, AMENDMENTS, AND THEN A VOTE ON THE CEO'S COMPENSATION. THE CEO IS NOTIFIED OF ANY CHANGE IN COMPENSATION AND A NOTICE OF CHANGE IS INCLUDED IN THE CEO'S PERSONNEL FILE. THE BOARD CONSIDERS SALARY SURVERYS FOR OTHER KEY EMPLOYEES ON AN ANNUAL BASIS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, Line 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION'S GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, FINANCIAL STATEMENTS, AND CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY ARE AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC UPON REASONABLE REQUEST.
